summary: This document is an email chain from August 2019 between FBI agents and US Marshals discussing the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's activities on Little St. James Island. It includes leads on potential witnesses (Vanessa, Pat, Kim, Anna) who worked on or near the island, mentions Epstein's use of NDAs, and references his travel with unidentified females to Austria. The correspondence occurs shortly after Epstein's death in August 2019.

persons.name: Paul Byrne
persons.context: Listed as a recipient (Cc) on the initial email, suggesting involvement in the investigative correspondence.

persons.name: Vanessa
persons.context: Worked on Jeffrey Epstein's property in St. Thomas for a week; her fianc√© recently quit. She is a potential contact for finding more people who worked on the island.

persons.name: Pat
persons.role: Air Traffic Controller (ATC) on St. Thomas
persons.context: An ATC on St. Thomas who stated they saw similar things as Kim regarding Epstein traveling with underage girls.

persons.name: Anna
persons.context: A female named by Vanessa who allegedly 'knows all JEs secrets.'

persons.name: Kim
persons.context: Worked as an ATC for St. Thomas from March 2018 to April 2019. Reported seeing Jeffrey Epstein with underage girls disembarking from his jet and flying to his island via helicopter.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation. The email discusses his property, travel, alleged activities with underage girls, his pilots, and his death.

connections.description: Vanessa worked on Jeffrey Epstein's property for a week.
Kim, as an ATC, witnessed Epstein with underage girls traveling between his jet and helicopter to his island.
Pat, an ATC, reported similar sightings of Epstein with underage girls as Kim did.
Anna is described by Vanessa as someone who 'knows all JEs secrets,' suggesting a close confidante relationship.
Vanessa identified Anna as a female who knows Epstein's secrets, indicating Vanessa has knowledge of Anna.

events.title: FBI/USMS coordination on island witnesses
events.description: FBI agents email US Marshals to coordinate meeting with potential witnesses (Vanessa and Pat) on St. Thomas regarding the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Epstein's travel to Austria with females
events.description: Austrian authorities confirmed Jeffrey Epstein landed with three females, had coffee at The Coffee House Landmann, and then departed.

events.title: Epstein's death
events.description: Referenced indirectly as 'then Saturday happened,' indicating Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, which halted planned MLAT requests.

events.title: Kim's ATC tenure and observations
events.description: During her time as an Air Traffic Controller in St. Thomas, Kim observed Jeffrey Epstein with underage girls traveling via his jet and helicopter to his island.

keyFacts: Air Traffic Controllers (Kim and Pat) reported witnessing Jeffrey Epstein with underage girls disembarking from his jet and transferring to his helicopter for travel to Little St. James Island.
Witnesses who worked on or near Epstein's property were bound by a $1 million Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA) and were reportedly 'petrified' to talk before his death.
Epstein provided apartments for his pilots on St. Thomas under one of his company names, located near the airport.
Austrian authorities confirmed Epstein traveled to Austria on March 22, 2019, with three unidentified females.
The email chain shows active coordination between the FBI and U.S. Marshals Service to interview witnesses on St. Thomas shortly after Epstein's death in August 2019.
